001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
011
012import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Coordinates.DuplicateResolution;
013
014/**
015 * An empirical kernel function.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface describes a kernel function defined by a set of discrete
019 * points. It includes methods to compute the minimum and maximum x values, and
020 * to construct an interpolator for the points. The interpolator is used to
021 * compute the raw value of the kernel at any given x.
022 *
023 * @author Rob Challen
024 */
025@Value.Immutable
026@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalKernel.class)
027@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalKernel.class)
028public interface EmpiricalKernel extends Serializable, KernelFunction {
029
030        /**
031         * Constructs an interpolator for the kernel function based on the x and y
032         * values.
033         *
034         * <p>
035         * This method creates a {@link Coordinates} object from the x and y values,
036         * and then constructs a cubic spline interpolator using the
037         * {@link SplineInterpolator}. The interpolator can be used to compute the
038         * raw value of the kernel at any given x.
039         *
040         * <p>
041         * Note: The choice of cubic spline interpolation is a design decision; other
042         * interpolation methods could be used depending on the desired properties of
043         * the kernel function.
044         *
045         * @return an interpolator for the kernel function based on the x and y
046         *         values.
047         */
048        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
049        default Interpolator getInterpolator() {
050
051                Coordinates tmp = ImmutableCoordinates.builder()
052                                .setX(Arrays.stream(this.getT()).asDoubleStream().toArray())
053                                .setY(this.getY()).setXMin(this.getMinimum())
054                                .setXMax(this.getMaximum()).setXLink(LinkFunction.NONE)
055                                .setYLink(this.getLink()).setIncreasing(false)
056                                .setResolveDuplicates(DuplicateResolution.MEAN).build();
057
058//              if (getX().length < 20) {
059
060                return SplineInterpolator.createCubicSpline(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
061
062//              } else {
063//                      return LoessInterpolator.createLoessInterpolator(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
064//              }
065        }
066
067        /**
068         * The link function applied to the y values.
069         *
070         * <p>
071         * This function is used to transform the y values before interpolation. The
072         * default is {@link LinkFunction#NONE}, which means no transformation is
073         * applied. Other link functions can be used to model different types of
074         * relationships between x and y, such as logarithmic or logistic links.
075         *
076         * @return the link function applied to the y values, defaulting to NONE.
077         */
078        @Value.Default
079        default LinkFunction getLink() { return LinkFunction.NONE; }
080
081        /**
082         * Computes the maximum x value of the kernel function.
083         *
084         * <p>
085         * This method computes the maximum by streaming the x values and finding the
086         * maximum. It returns 0 if the array is empty, but in practice the array
087         * should contain valid x values for a meaningful kernel function.
088         *
089         * @return the maximum x value of the kernel function, or 0 if the array is
090         *         empty.
091         */
092        @Override @Value.Default
093        default int getMaximum() {
094                return Arrays.stream(this.getT()).max().orElse(0);
095        }
096
097        /**
098         * Computes the minimum x value of the kernel function.
099         *
100         * <p>
101         * This method computes the minimum by streaming the x values and finding the
102         * minimum. It returns 0 if the array is empty, but in practice the array
103         * should contain valid x values for a meaningful kernel function.
104         *
105         * @return the minimum x value of the kernel function, or 0 if the array is
106         *         empty.
107         */
108        @Override @Value.Default
109        default int getMinimum() {
110                return Arrays.stream(this.getT()).min().orElse(0);
111        }
112
113        /**
114         * The x values of the kernel function.
115         *
116         * <p>
117         * These values are used to construct the interpolator and to compute the
118         * minimum and maximum x values. They should be provided in ascending order
119         * for consistency, but the implementation will handle unsorted input.
120         *
121         * @return an array of integers representing the x values of the kernel
122         *         function.
123         */
124        int[] getT();
125
126        /**
127         * The y values of the kernel function.
128         *
129         * <p>
130         * These values are used to construct the interpolator. They should
131         * correspond to the x values in {@link #getT()} and be of the same length.
132         *
133         * @return an array of doubles representing the y values of the kernel
134         *         function.
135         *
136         */
137        double[] getY();
138
139        /**
140         * Computes the raw value of the kernel function at a given x.
141         *
142         * <p>
143         * This method uses the interpolator to compute the value at x, and then
144         * applies the inverse of the link function to transform it back to the
145         * original scale. The result is the raw value of the kernel function at x.
146         *
147         * @param x the input value for which to compute the kernel function
148         * @return the raw value of the kernel function at x
149         */
150        @Override
151        default double rawValue(int x) {
152                return this.getLink().invFn(this.getInterpolator().interpolate(x));
153        }
154
155}
